alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 02 at 6:08AM PST until March 02 at 11:04AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Cowlitz River At Randle affecting Lewis County. .No additional hydrologically significant rain is in the forecast for the next few days. The Cowlitz River at Randle will continue to recede through the day below flood stage. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Cowlitz River At Randle. * WHEN...Until late this morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, the Cowlitz River will cause minor flooding from the vicinity of Randle downstream through Riffe Lake...covering nearby farm lands and several roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 19.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:15 PM PST Tuesday was 19.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this morning at 1115 AM PST.
